718219f-a.title: Manhattan: 59th Street - 5th Avenue
718219f-a.text:
Central Park: The Circle at 59th Street and Fifth Ave., showing
this entrance to the southeastern corner of the Park. Technically
this is a portion of the Grand Army Plaza.
About 1895.
Ewing Galloway.

709033f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 59th Street
709033f-a.text:
Fifth Avenue,West side from north of West 59th Street,
looking southwards. The Vanderbilt mansion may be seen
'across Tlaza Sqquare on the South West corner of W.59th Street,
and looking southwards on the Avenue,the spires may be seen
of the Fifth hvonue Presbyterian Charch.
About 1900.
Vrbrock Collection,
Credit line Imperative.
View E . Nleg 4t oo9

709073f.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 59th Street
709073f.text:
Fifth Avenue, north from 59th Street, Central Park 2oo is in
the centre.
Ewing Galloway  about 1910
Ne( ~7w7

714019f-a.title: Manhattan: 59th Street (West) - 5th Avenue
714019f-a.text:
22-24 West 59th Street, south side, between Fifth and Sixth Avenues,
showing two old apartment houses, 1ong neglected, which adjoin
the Plaza Hotel.
About 1922.
Brown Brothers.

718322f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 59th Street
718322f-a.text:
(1)
Central Park: A pathway and trees in the southern part of the par
the view is south towards the Plasa Hotel.
1923.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
Slightly eastward to show through the trees the Hotel Netherlan
ytfth Ave. and 59th Street.
1923.
P. L. Sperr.

ytfth Ave. and 59th Street.

709076f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 59th Street
709076f-a.text:
Hotel Netherland, Fifth Avenue at N.E. corner of 59th Street.
Demolished in 1927 for construction of Hotel Savoy-Plaza.
About 1923.

720062f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 59th Street
720062f-a.text:
Seuth on Fifth Avenue from 59th Street, showing Pulitzer
Fountain at Plaza and Vanderbilt Chateau, Fifth Avenue, wet side
57th to 58th Streets.
About 1923.

709057f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 59th Street
709057f-a.text:
Savoy Hotel, S.E. corner of Fifth Avenue and 59th Street, now
demolished.
June, 1925.

720066f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 59th Street
720066f-a.text:
South on Fifth Avenue from 59th Street, showing Plaza.
At extneme right is Plaza Hotel.
Vanderbilt Mansion and Heckacher Building in centre foreground.
About 1925.
Photograph by Ewing Galloway.

709077f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 59th Street
709077f-a.text:
Fire which destroyed scaffolding on tower of incompleted Sherry Neth-
erlands Hotel, Fifth Avenue at N.E. corner of 59th Street. No dam-
age was done to the structure itself.
April 12, 1927.
International News Photograph

714021f-a.title: Manhattan: 59th Street - 5th Avenue
714021f-a.text:
59th Street (Central Park South), south side, from Sixth to Fifth
Avenues. At the right, on the S.E. corner of Sixth Avenue, is
the old New York Athletic Club. This will soon be demolished and
a new building erected on the S.E. coIner of Seventh Avenue and
59th Street. At the left are the hotels Plaza and Savoy-Plaza.
May 25, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.

718408f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 59th Street (West)
718408f-a.text:
Central Park: The southern edge of same as viewed in a southward
direction and showing the apartment ridge on Central Park South (West
59th Street) from Fifth Ave. (left) to Columbus Circle (right, not shown).
Note in the center background, the Chrysler Building under construction.
1930.
Ewing Galloway.

718236f-b.title: Manhattan: 59th Street - 5th Avenue
718236f-b.text:
(1)
Central Park: The Lake, a view south southeast, towards 59th
Street west of FiYth Avenue. In the middle of the picture
the tower of the Chrysler Building rises above the Hotel Plaza.
JV1Y 12, 1V31.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, another view, taken from the western side of the
willow tree in the foreground.
July 12, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same, four years later. The gigantic bulk of the R. C. A.
Building, in Radio City, has been added to the skyline.
June 24, 1935.

718236f-a.title: Manhattan: 59th Street - 5th Avenue

(1)

718294f-b.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 59th Street
718294f-b.text:
Central Park, Miscellaneous: A set of 2 views showing a demonstration
of foresters safety eduipment in the southeastern corner of the Park.
Buildings shown(from left to right) at Fifth Ave. and 59th Street are
the Sherry Netherland, the Savoy-Plasa, the Squibb Building and the
Plsza Hotel.
About 1930.
A. L. Schussler.

718294f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 59th Street
718294f-a.text:
Central Park, Miscellaneous: A set of 2 views showing a demonstration
of foresters safety eduipment in the southeastern corner of the Park.
Buildings shown(from left to right) at Fifth Ave. and 59th Street are
the Sherry Netherland, the Savoy-Plasa, the Squibb Building and the
Plsza Hotel.
About 1930.
A. L. Schussler.

718407f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 59th Street (West)
718407f-a.text:
Central Park: An eastward view to Fifth Ave., across the southern
edge of the Park. Buildings on the right are on the south side of Central
Park South (West 59th Street), east from Columbus Circle.
About 1931.
Ewing Galloway.

718433f-a.title: Manhattan: 59th Street (West) - 5th Avenue
718433f-a.text:
Central Park South, east from and including Seventh to Fifth Aves.
Shown in the foreground and in the order of their appearance, are the N.Y.
Athletic Club (No. 130-, Essex House (Nos. 170-1604, Hampshire House (No. 150)
Centre Ass'n (No. 120) Navarro (No. 112), Barbizon Plaza (No. 106-100), St.
Moritn (No. 56) and the Sherry Netherland Hotel (N.E. corner of 59th Street
and Fifth Ave).  Central Park forms the north side of this street, which
technically should be West 59th Street.
1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Writers Project.

714018f.title: Manhattan: 59th Street (West) - 5th Avenue
714018f.text:
WWest E9th Strect, at Fifth Avenue (shown on the left), showing
several open barouches at the Grand Army Plaza. On the left appears
buildings on the east side of Fifth Avenue, south from but not includ-
ing East 59th Street, to and including East 57th Street, showing on
the extreme left margin a portion of the Savo-Plaza Hotel. Across
the truck appears the female figurine atop the Pulitzer Memorial.
No. 1 is an enlargegwent made bw the photographer; No. 2 being a copv
of the original negative bv the N.Y.P.L.
About 1936.
Gift of Dr. Michael Wishengrad A.R.P.S.

732855f-b.title: Recreation and hobbies - Miscellaneous - Children.
732855f-b.text:
(1)
Recreations and hobbies, miscellaneous: Children eating a bit of
lunch during dips.in the water at the foot of the Fountain of Abundance.
in the Grand Army Plaza on Fifth Ave., at 59th Street. Buildings shown
on the right line the east side of same, northward.
August 4, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same in a northwestward direction with the southern edge of
Central Park forming a background.
August 4, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

732855f-a.title: Recreation and hobbies - Miscellaneous - Children.
732855f-a.text:
(1)
Recreations and hobbies, miscellaneous: Children eating a bit of

(2)

August 4, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

718356f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 59th Street
718356f-a.text:
Central Park: A set of 2 views of the Pond, located in the
South East corner, as viewed in that direction to show ab ve same
buildinas on Fifth Avenue at 59th Street. From left to right they
are the Hotel Pierre, Rit Tower, Sherry-Netherland, Savoy-Plaza,
Squibbs Bldg. and the Plaza.
Aoril 23, 1938.
Views 1 and 2
P. L. Sperr,

718356f-b.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 59th Street
718356f-b.text:
Central Park: A set of 2 views of the Pond, located in the
South East corner, as viewed in that direction to show ab ve same
buildinas on Fifth Avenue at 59th Street. From left to right they

733383f-a.title: Transportation - Horse-drawn open barouche.
733383f-a.text:
Transportation: A horsedrawn open barouche at Central Fsrk
(Fifth Avenue and 59th Street). The Hotel Plasa forms a background.
1938-9
Alexander Alland
This photo is one of a series that appeared in the published volume
'Portrait of N. Y." by Felix Reisenberg and Alex. Alland, IRGV.
733383f-a.folder: Fifth Avenue and 59th Street, Manhattan, N.Y.

733384f.title: Transportation - [A horse drawn open barouche in Central Park.]

718423f-a.title: Manhattan: 59th Street (West) - 5th Avenue
718423f-a.text:
(1)
Central Park South, west from Fifth Ave., to Columbus Circle,
showing buildings that face the southern edge of Central Park. At the
left is the Plaza Hotel; in the center, on the S.E. corner of Sixth
Ave., is the New York Athletic Club, and beyond it, though dimly
visible, are the Spanish Flats.
December 1925.
Brown Brothers.
(2)
A similar view from the northern half of the Grand Army Plaza,
showing the change in the building outline; prominent of which are the
St. Moritn Hotel and the Essex House.
August 4, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

718213f-b.title: Manhattan: 59th Street - 5th Avenue
718213f-b.text:
(1)
Central Park: A view of the southeastern entrance to the Park, with
the equestrian statue of General Sherman at the N. W. corner of 59th Street
( foreground ),at 5th Avenue. The buildings shown on the extreme right are
on the east side of the Avenue.
May 12, i9i0.
Walter L. Bogert.
(2)
The same, at a later date. Note the change of the Fifth Ave. outline.
The horse drawn carriage is a local feature of this vicinity.
August 4, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same, as No. 2 from a view point slightly southward and showing in
the foreground a portion of the Fountain of Abundance. in the Grand Army
Plasa, which is not a part of the park.
Auguat 4, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

718213f-a.title: Manhattan: 59th Street - 5th Avenue
718213f-a.text:
(1)
Central Park: A view of the southeastern entrance to the Park, with
the equestrian statue of General Sherman at the N. W. corner of 59th Street
( foreground ),at 5th Avenue. The buildings shown on the extreme right are
on the east side of the Avenue.
May 12, i9i0.
Walter L. Bogert.
(2)
The same, at a later date. Note the change of the Fifth Ave. outline.
The horse drawn carriage is a local feature of this vicinity.
August 4, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same, as No. 2 from a view point slightly southward and showing in
the foreground a portion of the Fountain of Abundance. in the Grand Army
Plasa, which is not a part of the park.
Auguat 4, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

709048f-a.text:
Fifth Avenue, south, from 59th Street, showing office building
centre on site of old Vanderbilt Mansion.
About 1932.
Ewing Galloway, Photographer.

718354f.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 59th Street
718354f.text:
Centrel Park: . night scene aoross the southeastern corner of the Park,
sowing buildings on Fifth Avenue at 59th Street, reflected in the Boat
Lake. Prominent of these are, the Hotel Pierre, the Savoy-Plaza, the
Hotel Netherland and the squibb Building. No.1 is an enlargement made
by the photographer: No. 2 being a copy made by the N.Y.P.L.
About 1936.
0ift of Dr. Michael Wishengrad F.R.P.S.

731245f-b.title: Celebrations - Parades - Municipal events - Miscellaneous.
731245f-b.text:
Celebrations, Parades ano Municipal Events: Parade
(UnknownJ passing the Sherman statue on Fifth Avenue at
59th Street. (Mount No. 1).
A set of 3 views showing marching contingents moving
southward on the Avenue to be reviewed from stand at the
Sherman Monument.
The latter is to the S. E. corner of Central Park
and is tecnnically located in a small plot that officially
is the Grand Army Plaza.
Massed groups to the right are linig the east side
of Fifth Avenue, north of 59th Street icrosstown car there-
upon).
Pmior to 1924
Views: 1-2-3

731246f-d.title: Celebrations - Parades - Municipal events - Miscellaneous.
731246f-d.text:
Celebrations, Paraues and Municipal Events: Parade
(unknewn) pasSing the Sherman statue on Fifth Nvenue at
59th Street. (wount 2).
Four views photographed in a northward direction up
the Avenue to show details of a parade moving southward on
same. The car tracks see are of the crosstown line at 59th
Street.
TThe other two views are below this point and one
sees a portion of the old Hotel Savoy at the S.E. corner
of 59th Street. This structure, demolished in 1924 and
replaced with the modern Savoy-Pla2a Hotel, dates these photos.
prior to 1924
Views: 1-2-3-4
